examples: And pathos is an appeal to emotion, or humanity.
One of the hardest tones to play as an actor is to play both pathos and humor, and he does it with such a delicate touch in this scene.

If The Doctor were trying to convince aliens not to destroy Earth, she could use logos by explaining factual reasons why Earth isn’t a threat, ethos by using the power of her name to inspire awe, and pathos by talking about the human spirit and the power of kindness.
words.defineEn: a quality that arouses emotions (especially pity or sorrow)
words.defineVi: một phẩm chất khơi dậy cảm xúc (đặc biệt là thương hại hoặc buồn bã)

examples: But they still have the pathology, the retinal issues, that they still require exams once a year.
It was a form of pathology by embarking on spoken word over and over and over again and reciting my poems.
He studied anatomy and pathology, and wrote books and articles about using microscopes to examine tissue samples.
This - this is is a huge pathology.
He showed that Boule’s reconstruction of the Old Man wasn’t affected by the Old Man’s pathologies, as some had argued.
words.defineEn: a branch of medical science primarily focusing on the study of the causes and effects of disease or injury
words.defineVi: một nhánh của khoa học y tế chủ yếu tập trung vào nghiên cứu nguyên nhân và ảnh hưởng của bệnh tật hoặc chấn thương

words.defineEn: a juvenile between the onset of puberty and maturity
words.defineVi: một vị thành niên giữa lúc bắt đầu dậy thì và trưởng thành

examples: But the state's stringent I.D. requirements are keeping many undocumented workers from getting the shot.
While there are health and safety regulations placed on the bottled water industry, they are actually less stringent than municipal ones.
In September, California passed a new stringent Consumer Call Protection Act of 2019, shifting the burden of compliance to service providers instead of the callers themselves.
Europe has pushed forward stringent legislation voting to ban all single-use plastic utensils, straws and cotton swabs from the EU beginning in 2021.
It's clear that both nations must strive for more stringent targets.
words.defineEn: (of a law, regulation, rule, etc.) extremely limiting and strict
words.defineVi: (của luật, quy định, quy tắc, v.v.) cực kỳ hạn chế và nghiêm ngặt

examples: It goes against the strictures of the Federal Reserve and the fact that the Federal Reserve keeps interest rates at artificially low levels and constantly encourages households, corporations and Uncle Sam to borrow.
The Surrealists were influenced by the work of Sigmund Freud and sought ways to free themselves from the strictures of the conscious mind.
And this whole system was based on a set of strong cultural and religious beliefs, establishing caste as a right of birth and living within the strictures of your caste as a moral and spiritual duty.
words.defineEn: severe criticism
words.defineVi: chỉ trích nặng nề

examples: He had a lot of dishonest partners who really took him to the cleaners.
A new law is proposed to curb this type of blatantly dishonest description, and not before time
She's not the sharpest knife in the drawer, but she isn't dishonest
Despite their pleas for forgiveness, the company did not give the dishonest employees house room and terminated their contracts immediately.
It is against the grain for me to tackle dishonest people.
words.defineEn: deceitful or intending to trick people
words.defineVi: lừa dối hoặc có ý định lừa người

examples: Instead, their energy comes in discrete levels.
Light travels in discrete packets and behaves like a particle.
In this way, their legacies remain connected as discrete elements in a vast network of knowledge.
They've actually integrated 12 discrete temperature sensors throughout the phone.
And the claims were for celestial bodies, rather than discrete bodies of land down here on boring old regular Earth.
words.defineEn: constituting a separate entity or part
words.defineVi: cấu thành một thực thể hoặc một phần riêng biệt

examples: When the group of friends decided to explore the dark and eerie forest, John thought that discretion is the better part of valor, and decided to stay behind.
It takes away discretion from judges.
Viewer discretion is advised.
And so the governors have a lot of discretion.
They had the discretion to do that.
words.defineEn: the power or freedom of making decisions in a particular situation
words.defineVi: sức mạnh hoặc quyền tự do đưa ra quyết định trong một tình huống cụ thể

examples: Hollywood discriminates against Jews.
Opioids do not discriminate.
Is the university discriminating against humans in its application process?
It doesn't discriminate.
And, Harry, you use the word discriminate.
words.defineEn: distinguish
words.defineVi: phân biệt

examples: He disdains lack of control.
It was about disdain for our flag and law enforcement and contempt for America.
And Trump expressed his personal disdain.
Meanwhile, Loki watched Hermod’s mission with disdain.
But do the Swedish people, do they have a disdain for the Swedish chef?
words.defineEn: look down on with disdain
words.defineVi: nhìn xuống với sự khinh bỉ

words.defineEn: the state of being carelessly or partially dressed
words.defineVi: tình trạng mặc quần áo bất cẩn hoặc một phần

examples: When he finally emerged, his disheveled appearance made him look a sight to behold.
He looks like something the cat brought in with his disheveled hair and dirty clothes.
We began to see vacillating practices by the staff and Mama began to look disheveled.
words.defineEn: a person's untidy or messy appearance, typically their hair or clothing, as if it has not been properly groomed or cared for
words.defineVi: vẻ bề ngoài không gọn gàng hoặc lộn xộn của một người, điển hình là tóc hoặc quần áo của họ, như thể nó không được chải chuốt hoặc chăm sóc đúng cách

examples: - Let's disrobe on the count of three.
And so, after he locked the door, he had me get on the table, disrobe, put my feet in stirrups, and proceeded to give me an examination without gloves.
words.defineEn: get undressed
words.defineVi: cởi đồ ra

examples: Once you take it out, you wil feel excruciating pain for ten years!
MALCOLM BRABANT: After being rear-ended by a truck 15 years ago, locksmith Kerry Irving endured excruciating back pain that left him depressed, too anxious to leave home, and even suicidal.

The cornea is like the window that lets light into the eye, and if you’ve ever experienced the excruciating pain of a scratched one, you know how terrible it can be to damage something so loaded with pain receptors.
words.defineEn: subject to torture
words.defineVi: chịu sự tra tấn

examples: Would that then make your inaction more excusable?
words.defineEn: capable of being overlooked
words.defineVi: có khả năng bị bỏ qua

words.defineEn: an interpretation and thorough explanation of a piece of writing, particularly a religious one
words.defineVi: một giải thích và giải thích kỹ lưỡng về một phần của văn bản, đặc biệt là một tôn giáo

examples: Wait, unless your MY literary executor.
Just a friendly note, by the way, to any future literary executors out there, maybe don’t burn so much stuff?
And even with the funeral taken care of, Brianna’s still not done yet because she’s the executor on Martha’s estate.
words.defineEn: a person appointed by a testator to carry out the terms of the will
words.defineVi: một người được người lập di chúc chỉ định để thực hiện các điều khoản của di chúc

examples: Some other alternatives are humane traps and ultrasonic pest repellers.
And it sounded very humane.
MAN: Here, it's a bit more humane.
I do raise my own chickens for their eggs and I support humane farming.
You're encouraging other people to live as humane people.
words.defineEn: characterized by a kind and compassionate approach towards other people and animals
words.defineVi: được đặc trưng bởi cách tiếp cận tử tế và từ bi đối với người và động vật khác

examples: Humanitarian groups warned of a long-term disaster.
This is a humanitarian catastrophe.
There’s a humanitarian crisis there.
We are continuing with humanitarian work.
Just showing up in humanitarian assistance roles and disasters.
words.defineEn: involved in or related to helping people who are in need to improve their living conditions
words.defineVi: tham gia hoặc liên quan đến việc giúp đỡ những người có nhu cầu cải thiện điều kiện sống của họ

examples: Romero is humanizing the undead.
I’m trying to humanize it.
And so, at this moment, my call to action was to humanize us by getting our stories out there.
And so that gives them, kind of, it humanizes them a little bit, and makes us feel kind of bad for them.
Our mission here has been to bring positivity and optimism, and humanize the situation.
words.defineEn: make more humane
words.defineVi: làm cho nhân văn hơn
